metadata.title: CVE-2016-9112 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Floating Point Exception (aka FPE or divide by zero) in opj_pi_next_cprlfunction in openjp2/pi.c:523 in OpenJPEG 2.1.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9112` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.2.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-1').
